intro: Dianthus rogowiczii, commonly known as the Armenian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. Dianthus rogowiczii is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant in temperate climates.
